job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: ltpgtltstronggtSummaryltstronggtltpgtltpgtAs a Data Scientist at Fast you will partner closely with product managers engineering design marketing sales or other operational leaders to define core metricsKPIs generate actionable data insights from large datasets build automated dashboards using data pipelines and run experiments to measure impact of new initiativesltpgtltpgtampnbspltpgtltpgtltstronggtRoleltstronggtltpgtltulgtltligtRun complex data queries analyze large datasets and run statistical analyses to continuously drive deeper understanding of our customers and product performanceltligtltligtCreate dashboards and reports with effective data visualizationsltligtltligtBe a thought partner to business leaders in determining quantitative success and process improvementltligtltligtBuild data pipelines and create scripts to automate processes and reportsltligtltligtBuild models to improve our understanding of user behavior and predict future performanceampnbspltligtltulgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltstronggtRequirementsltstronggtltpgtltulgtltligt3 years of experience in quantitative analysis rolesltligtltligtFluent in SQL and a scripting language R PythonltligtltligtKnowledge of experimentation and statistical methodsltligtltligtBS in quantitative field or equivalent experienceltligtltligtSkilled with Looker Jupyter Notebook and other data visualization toolsltligtltulgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltstronggtNice to Haveltstronggtltpgtltulgtltligt5 years of experience in quantitative analysis rolesltligtltligtAdvanced degree in quantitative field or equivalent experienceltligtltligtKnowledge of building data pipelines eg dbt airflowltligtltligtExperience in ecommerce industryltligtltligtPrevious mature startup experienceltligtltulgtltpgtltpgt
